alert.note: Alert for Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 12:36AM CDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... West Branch 12 Mile Creek At Dumont affecting Traverse County. .The following river forecasts include forecast precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any additional future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...West Branch 12 Mile Creek At Dumont. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM CDT Friday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 AM CDT Friday was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Saturday.
